comment.author: 61804295@N00
comment._content: This is a view across Neutral Bay past the tip, on the right, of North Sydney Wharf, to Elamang Ave along Careening Cove, Kirribilli. On the left is what seems to be the site of Kirribilli House. On the immediate left in this photo, off camera, is my Grandfather's house, "Once Upon a Time", which was moved from Garden Island by the Navy before the War, for expansion of the dockyard. The remaining units, or flats, remain at "Wyldefel Gardens", Potts Point. This image of a ferry coming into the jetty.. www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2734804658/ indicates the dates of the photos predate the construction of "Once Upon A Time" ie 1936, I have a number of shots of the original buildings ,and a few modern ones of "Once Upon A Time" Here is a recent one from the the 2009 New Year www.flickr.com/photos/spelio/3177092046/ with links to a few more sites that mention Wyldefel Gardens.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This picture is in the book "A Pictorial History Of Ferries Sydney etc" by Graeme Andrews, Reed 1982. The author identifies the ferry as the "Waringa" of 1894. More ferry info: www.ferriesofsydney.com/waringa.html

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: This photograph and the previous three posted here, all show the Waringa and/or the surounding area. There is a fith picture I have seen which shows the same Manly ferries in the same positions at their base, taken from the other side of Neutral Bay. It is highly likely they were all taken on the same day.
